Introduction¶

The ddot (Data-Driven Ontology Toolkit) package makes the construction, analysis, and manipulation of ontologies simple.

The ddot package is both a Python library and a set of REST web-services that wrap around the Python library.

Dependencies¶

1. cxmate (optional for web-services) 2.

Features¶

  1. Reading, writing, and conversion of data-driven ontologies a. Parse OBO files b. Conversion to and from flat table files, NetworkX, igraph c. Interface with the NDEx (Network Database Exchange).
  1. Construction of data-driven ontologies using the CLIXO algorithm
  2. Alignment of two ontologies
  3. Basic manipulations a. Propagate gene annotations b. Calculate statistics like term sizes and balance c. Identify a spanning tree for visualization d. Collapsing ontology to non-redundant terms
  4. Expand set of seed genes
  5. Convert genotypes to ontotypes.
  6. Set of REST web-services that interface with networks in NDEx

  2. Yu et al.
